sn39.16:4.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, in this teaching and training, what is hard to do?”
sn39.16:4.2: “Going forth, reverend, is hard to do in this teaching and training.”
sn39.16:4.3: “But what’s hard to do for someone who has gone forth?”
sn39.16:4.4: “When you’ve gone forth it’s hard to be satisfied.”
sn39.16:4.5: “But what’s hard to do for someone who is satisfied?”
sn39.16:4.6: “When you’re satisfied, it’s hard to practice in line with the teaching.”
sn39.16:4.7: “But if a mendicant practices in line with the teaching, will it take them long them to become a perfected one?”
sn39.16:7.1: The Linked Discourses with Sāmaṇḍaka are complete.
